objectiveDescription: Define and maintain appropriate business process controls to ensure that information related to and processed by in-house or outsourced business processes satisfies all relevant information control requirements. Identify the relevant information control requirements. Manage and operate adequate input, throughput and output controls (application controls) to ensure that information and information processing satisfy these requirements.
objectivePurpose: Maintain information integrity and the security of information assets handled within business processes in the enterprise or its outsourced operation.

subComponents.subComponentName: Portfolio of competitive products and services

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Percent of products and services that meet or exceed targets in revenues and/or market share
Percent of products and services that meet or exceed customer satisfaction targets
Percent of products and services that provide competitive advantage
Time to market for new products and services
Satisfaction survey of key stakeholders regarding the transparency, understanding and accuracy of enterprise financial information
Cost of noncompliance with finance-related regulations
Degree of board and executive management satisfaction with decision-making information
Number of incidents caused by incorrect business decisions based on inaccurate information
Time to provide information supporting effective business decisions
Timeliness of management information

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Optimization of internal business process functionality

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Satisfaction levels of board and executive management with business process capabilities
Satisfaction levels of customers with service delivery capabilities
Satisfaction levels of suppliers with supply chain capabilities

subComponents.subComponentName: Delivery of I&T services in line with business requirements

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Percent of business stakeholders satisfied that I&T service delivery meets agreed service levels
Number of business disruptions due to I&T service incidents
Percent of users satisfied with the quality of I&T service delivery
Level of user satisfaction with quality, timeliness and availability of I&T-related management information, taking into account available resources
Ratio and extent of erroneous business decisions in which erroneous or unavailable I&T-related information was a key factor
Percentage of information meeting quality criteria

subComponents.subComponentDescription: Engage with stakeholders to establish and maintain a monitoring approach to define the objectives, scope and method for measuring business solution and service delivery and contribution to enterprise objectives. Integrate this approach with the corporate performance management system.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Identify stakeholders (e.g., management, process owners and users).

Engage with stakeholders and communicate the enterprise requirements and objectives for monitoring, aggregating and reporting, using common definitions (e.g., business glossary, metadata and taxonomy), baselining and benchmarking

Align and continually maintain the monitoring and evaluation approach with the enterprise approach and the tools to be used for data gathering and enterprise reporting (e.g., business intelligence applications).
Agree on the types of goals and metrics (e.g., conformance, performance, value, risk), taxonomy (classification and relationships between goals and metrics) and data (evidence) retention.
Request, prioritize and allocate resources for monitoring, consider appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness and confidentiality
Periodically validate the approach used and identify new or changed stakeholders, requirements and resources.
Agree on a life cycle management and change control process for monitoring and reporting. Include improvement opportunities for reporting, metrics, approach, baselining and benchmarking.

subComponents.subComponentDescription: Work with stakeholders to define, periodically review, update and approve performance and conformance targets within the performance measurement system

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Define the goals and metrics. Periodically review them with stakeholders to identify any significant missing items and define reasonableness of targets and tolerances.
Evaluate whether the goals and metrics are adequate, that is, specific, measurable, achievable, relevant and time-bound (SMART).
Communicate proposed changes to performance and conformance targets and tolerances (relating to metrics) with key due diligence stakeholders (e.g., legal, audit, HR, ethics, compliance, finance).
Publish changed targets and tolerances to users of this information.
string
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-53, Revisionv5 (Draft), August 2017

subComponents.subComponentName: Collect and process performance and conformance data.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Collect and process timely and accurate data aligned with enterprise approaches.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Collect data from defined processes (automated, where possible).
Assess efficiency (effort in relation to insight provided) and appropriateness (usefulness and meaning) of collected data and validate the data’s integrity (accuracy and completeness).
Aggregate data to support measurement of agreed metrics.
Align aggregated data to the enterprise reporting approach and objectives.
Use suitable tools and systems for the processing and analysis of data.
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-53, Revision 5 (Draft), August 2017

subComponents.subComponentDescription: Periodically review and report performance against targets. Use a method that provides a succinct all-around view of I&T performance and fits within the enterprise monitoring system.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Design process performance reports that are concise, easy to understand, and tailored to various management needs and audiences. Facilitate effective, timely decision making (e.g., scorecards, traffic light reports). Ensure that the cause and effect between goals and metrics are communicated in an understandable manner.
Distribute reports to the relevant stakeholders.

Analyze the cause of deviations against targets, initiate remedial actions, assign responsibilities for remediation, and follow up. At appropriate times, review all deviations and search for root causes, where necessary. Document the issues for further guidance if the problem recurs. Document results.

Where feasible, integrate performance and compliance into individual staff members’ performance objectives and link achievement of performance targets to the organizational reward compensation system.
Compare the performance values to internal targets and benchmarks and, where possible, to external benchmarks (industry and key competitors).
Analyze trends in performance and compliance and take appropriate action.
Recommend changes to the goals and metrics, where appropriate.
string
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-53, Revision 5 (Draft), August 2017

subComponents.subComponentName: Ensure the implementation of corrective actions.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Assist stakeholders in identifying, initiating and tracking corrective actions to address anomalies.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Review management responses, options and recommendations to address issues and major deviations.
Ensure that the assignment of responsibility for corrective action is maintained.
Track the results of actions committed.
Report the results to the stakeholders.

componentQuestions.policyDescription: Provides guidance for management’s responsibilities in assessing operations as part of the continuous improvement program. Often used to report internally to executives or board on current capabilities, progress and improvement, based on business requirements. Assessments may be used during or after a process improvement program (i.e., to assess progress after completing an improvement).

Encourages employees to raise concerns and questions in full confidence. Ensures employees that they will receive a response and be able to escalate concerns if they are not satisfied with the response. Assures that employees are protected when they raise issues and should not fear reprisal.

componentQuestions.keyCultureElement: To achieve the organization’s goals and optimize performance, promote a culture of continuous improvement of business and I&T processes.

componentQuestions.questionDescription: Performance measurement system (e.g., balanced scorecard, skills management tools), Self-assessment tools
